tidync

Activate

Set the context for subsequent manipulations.

activate(.data, what)

# S3 method for tidync
activate(.data, what)

# S3 method for hyperfilter
activate(.data, what)

# S3 method for tidync
active(x)

# S3 method for hyperfilter
active(x)

# S3 method for tidync
active(x) <- value

# S3 method for hyperfilter
active(x) <- value

Arguments

.data

NetCDF object
what

name of a variable
x

NetCDF object
value

name of variable to be active

Value

NetCDF object

Details

activate puts the named variable first active gets and sets the active variable

Examples

l3file <- system.file("extdata", "S2008001.L3m_DAY_CHL_chlor_a_9km.nc", package= "ncdump")
rnc <- tidync(l3file)
activate(rnc, "palette")
#> 
#> Data Source (1): S2008001.L3m_DAY_CHL_chlor_a_9km.nc ...
#> 
#> Grids (4) <dimension family> : <associated variables> 
#> 
#> [1]   D1,D0 : chlor_a
#> [2]   D3,D2 : palette    **ACTIVE GRID** ( 768  values per variable)
#> [3]   D0    : lat
#> [4]   D1    : lon
#> 
#> Dimensions (4): 
#>   
#>   dimension    id          name length unlim 
#>       <chr> <dbl>         <chr>  <dbl> <lgl> 
#> 1        D0     0           lat   2160 FALSE 
#> 2        D1     1           lon   4320 FALSE 
#> 3        D2     2           rgb      3 FALSE 
#> 4        D3     3 eightbitcolor    256 FALSE
